text: Python has a lot of gui librarys: tknter, wxWidgets, pyGTK etc.
But all this gui needs to be installed and quite heavyweight, so it's a bit complex to deploy end-user gui python apps that relay on mentioned gui librarys.
Recently, i have thinked about python build-in ctypes.
Theoretically, it's possible to create pure python gui library that will use ctypes on windows ( windll.user32.CreateWindowEx etc ), native pyObjC on MacOS and pyGTK / pyQt on gnome / kde.
If not, how do you think what's wrong with an idea?
